titles.title: How Sweet and Awful Is the Place

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: How sweet and awful is the place with Christ within the doors, while everlasting love displays the choicest of her stores.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: While all our hearts and all our songs join to admire the feast, each of us cries, with thankful tongue, "Lord, why was I a guest?

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "Why was I made to hear Thy voice, and enter while there's room, when thousands make a wretched choice, and rather starve than come?"

verse.name: v4
v5
verse.lines: Pity the nations, O our God, constrain the earth to come; send Thy victorious Word abroad, and bring the strangers home.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: We long to see Thy churches full, that all the chosen race may, with one voice and heart and soul, sing Thy redeeming grace.
